dcterms:creator: F. Chollet
dcterms:description: The Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC) is a general artificial intelligence benchmark that poses difficulties for pure machine learning methods due to its requirement for fluid intelligence with a focus on reasoning and abstraction. It comprises 1000 unique tasks where each task consists of a small set of input-output image pairs for training, and generally one or occasionally multiple test pairs for evaluation.
dcterms:title: Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC)

dcterms:creator: Y. Xu
E. B. Khalil
S. Sanner
dcterms:description: A subset of 160 object-centric ARC tasks that are categorized into recoloring tasks, movement tasks, and augmentation tasks, which involve changing object colors, positions, and aspects like size or pattern.
dcterms:title: ARC tasks (subset of 160 object-centric ARC tasks)

dcterms:creator: top quarks
dcterms:description: The Kaggle competition’s first-place solution for the ARC, which utilizes a directed acyclic graph to synthesize program solutions over a hand-crafted Domain Specific Language.
dcterms:title: Kaggle competition’s first-place solution

dcterms:creator: C. Lei
N. Lipovetzky
K. A. Ehinger
dcterms:description: Generalized Planning (GP) tasks that involve synthesizing plans that work for multiple environments, specifically tailored for the ARC tasks.
dcterms:title: Generalized Planning (GP) tasks
